author: ghosts_in_the_code
content: Thoughts on reducing staking rewards? 5M ETH staked is enough ... anything more is going to come through pools not individuals which is bad for security / regulatory capture

author: pietjepuk
content: As far as I know, the goal is still to aim for 8.3 million ETH to have enough validators for 64 shards. See https://github.com/ethereum/annotated-spec/blob/master/phase0/beacon-chain.md

author: ghosts_in_the_code
content: Awesome. After that reduce staking rewards?

author: pietjepuk
content:
If the number of validators increases to far beyond that (say like 16 M ETH staked), I would say reducing staking rewards makes sense. Provided of course those numbers (64 shards, minimum target of 8.3 M ETH) are still relevant.
There is definitely room for more research into what rewards makes sense, and also how the base rewards should be split up over the various validator duties.
